lead_paragraph: The World Health Organization said two incubation periods – or 42 days – had passed since the last known victim had tested negative for the deadly virus.

headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Africa; Sierra Leone: Ebola Flare-Up Has Ended, W.H.O. Says
headline.main: Ebola Flare-Up Has Ended in Sierra Leone, W.H.O. Says

snippet: The World Health Organization said two incubation periods – or 42 days – had passed since the last known victim had tested negative for the deadly virus.
abstract: World Health Organization says latest Ebola flare-up in Sierra Leone has ended.
